page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT IN GOOSTREY
page.content:
Goostrey is now very much a dormitory village with people travelling to work in a variety of places such as Crewe, Manchester, Northwich, Knutsford and Congleton. Most people travel by car, many making use of the convenient access to the M6 motorway at Holmes Chapel. The village has a station on the Crewe to Manchester line with an hourly service and extra trains at peak hours.
Employment in the survey area is mainly in farming, at Jodrell Bank, and in shops, the bank, the garage etc. in the village.
There are some self-employed people working from home including computer consultants, an author and a tree surgeon.
